critique: The document focuses on counterterrorism and information sharing. The primary emotions the President wants to elicit are likely joy (through increased security and protection), and reduced fear (by preventing terrorist attacks). There might be a sense of surprise at the efficiency and effectiveness of the new measures. Sadness, anger, and disgust are less relevant in this context, although there might be a subtle undercurrent of anger towards terrorists and disgust at their actions. The initial scores reflect this assessment.
